abstract: New York Times, in effort to continue vigorous digital expansion while controlling expenses, will offer voluntary buyout packages to employees in newsroom and several business departments at end of May.
lead_paragraph: The company’s executive committee said the move was intended to help achieve a more digitally focused newsroom and reach financial goals.

headline.main: New York Times Co. to Offer Buyouts to Employees
headline.print_headline: Times Co. to Offer Buyouts in News and Business Units

snippet: The company’s executive committee said the move was intended to help achieve a more digitally focused newsroom and reach financial goals.
